roleset.name: put a crown on somebody/thing

roles.note: The crown itself (physical artifact) is symbolic of the role or attribute, hence the ability to merge the two into one arg.

example.name: passive
example.text: In a sign of growing official tolerance for religion, Russian Orthodox priests were allowed to celebrate the 400th anniversary of the Moscow patriarchate in the Kremlin's 15th-century Uspensky Cathedral, where czars-1 were crowned [*-1] [*T*-3] ... .

example.name: with crown
example.text: Mary crowned John with a pot lid.

example.name: with attribute
example.text: John-1 was crowned *trace*-1 Emperor of Lower Slobovia.

roleset.note: Based on WSJ. Member of VNcls appoint-29.1, dub-29.3-1, butter-9.9.

roleset.name: Culminating Event

example.name: Crowning an endevor
example.text: On May 10, 1869, he was crowning a venture that had taken eight years when disaster struck.
example.arg: a venture that had taken eight years

example.name: Another conventional use of crowning
example.text: The crisis has shattered [Samaranch's]-1 hopes of [*-1] crowning his 18-year-tenure with this victory. .

roleset.note: Roleset by Katie based on internet search, parallel expansion of verbnet, propbank, and sense groupings. Updated by Julia 2/2012. No VNcls.

roleset.name: Highest point of

example.name: Example both arguements
example.text: Crenellated spires crown the Norman towers of St. Peters Cathedral.
example.arg: the Norman towers of St. Peters Cathedral.

example.name: Example with arguements in a different order
example.src: Example with arguements in a different order
example.type: Example with arguements in a different order
example.text: [*-1} Crowning the eastern slope is [Mount Monah Cemetery-1].

roleset.note: Roleset by Katie based on internet search, parallel expansion of verbnet, propbank, and sense groupings. VNcls butter-9.9.

roleset.name: Put an enamel cover over a tooth

example.name: Example with potentially rare arg 2
example.text: A cosmetic dentist may crown the teeth with porcelain veneers.

roleset.note: Roleset by Katie based on internet search, parallel expansion of verbnet, propbank, and sense groupings. VNcls butter-9.9.

frameset.note: Julia, 2/2012: crown.01 has an arg2 that should really be split up. crown.02 was a mess, and was missing an argument, so I went ahead and added it (the crowing event arg was missing, and although some of the examples showed it, it was left untagged. It was a core arg in some cases, too, so leaving it untagged or using an argM were not good options).
